mouthpiece.english: He shall be your spokesman to the people

rod-becomes-serpent.context: Aaron's rod becomes a serpent before Pharaoh
rod-becomes-serpent.hebrew: וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אַהֲרֹן אֶת מַטֵּהוּ לִפְנֵי פַרְעֹה... וַיְהִי לְתַנִּין
rod-becomes-serpent.english: Aaron cast down his rod before Pharaoh... and it became a serpent

holy-garments.hebrew: וְעָשִׂיתָ בִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ לְאַהֲרֹן אָחִיךָ לְכָבוֹד וּלְתִפְאָרֶת
holy-garments.english: You shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty

golden-calf.context: Aaron's weak excuse for the golden calf
golden-calf.english: I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf

blessing-people.english: The LORD bless you and keep you

incense-plague.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹד בֵּין הַמֵּתִים וּבֵין הַחַיִּים וַתֵּעָצַר הַמַּגֵּפָה
incense-plague.english: He stood between the dead and the living, and the plague was stopped

rod-budded.context: Aaron's rod buds to confirm his calling
rod-budded.english: It budded, and brought forth buds, and produced blossoms, and bore ripe almonds
